page.title: 06INTERESTING SNIPPETS
page.content: The original Pelham Wood was oak planted in 1787 north east of the present Pelham's Pillar. There are 150 deer living in the wood, the original deer escaped into the woods in 1940.A hole was blown into the retaining wall during a mortar shell practice.The deer escaped and bred to their present number. Just before the D Day invasion the U.S.A. army stored armed cars in the woods.This area lies in the extreme north-east of our block.Concrete roads were established and inspection pits built for the maintenance of the vehicles.Although the dump was not secret few people knew of its existance.The tenant of a local farm was responsible for its organisation. Race horses were trained on a ride in the wood which stretched from Pelham's Pillar to Foxdale Wood.
